SEARCH
Module PSP24
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.flow

Class GameFlow

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.flow.Flow
it.polimi.ingsw.view.flow.GameFlow
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameListenerInterface, ClientInterface, Runnable, Remote
public class GameFlow extends Flow implements Runnable, ClientInterface
Manages the flow of the game and interaction between client and server.

    • askReadyToStart

      public void askReadyToStart(GameImmutable model, String nick)
      The method repeatedly checks for user input until the user confirms they're ready by entering "y". If any other input is received, the method continues to wait for the correct input. Once the user confirms their readiness, the `setAsReady()` method is called to proceed with the next step.
      Parameters:
      model - The game model.
      nick - The nickname of the player.

    • askPickCard

      public void askPickCard(GameImmutable model)

      Parameters:
      model - The game model.

    • PickCardFromBoard

      public void PickCardFromBoard(CardType cardType, boolean drawFromDeck, int pos)

      Specified by:
      PickCardFromBoard in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      cardType - The type of card to pick (ResourceCard or GoldCard).
      drawFromDeck - True if picking from the deck, false if picking from visible cards.
      pos - The position of the card to pick (0 or 1).

    • requireInitialReady

      public void requireInitialReady(GameImmutable model, int indexPlayer) throws FileReadException
      Prompts the user to choose between the front or back of the available Initial Cards. The method continues prompting the user for a valid choice until one is provided. If an invalid choice is made, an error message is displayed and the user is prompted again. Once a valid choice is made, the selected card side (front or back) is sent to the server using `clientActions.setInitialCard(index)`.
      Specified by:
      requireInitialReady in interface GameListenerInterface
      Parameters:
      model - The game model GameImmutable.
      indexPlayer - The index of the player making the initial card selection.
      Throws:
      FileReadException

    • requireGoalsReady

      public void requireGoalsReady(GameImmutable model, int indexPlayer) throws RemoteException
      Requires the user to choose between two Objective Cards by displaying them, and then asks the user to select one by entering either 0 or 1. If the user's selection is invalid, an error message is displayed and the user is prompted again until a valid choice is made. Once a valid choice is made, the selected card is sent to the server using clientActions.setGoalCard(index).
      Specified by:
      requireGoalsReady in interface GameListenerInterface
      Parameters:
      model - The game model GameImmutable.
      indexPlayer - The index of the player making the choice.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is a network issue.
